newsitem.title: UK: Coffee seen heading for surplus by 97/98 - GNI.
newsitem.headline: Coffee seen heading for surplus by 97/98 - GNI.

text.p: The world coffee balance is expected to return to a supply surplus of 2.76 million 60-kg bags in the 1997/98 (Oct-Sept) season after three consecutive years of deficit. World production is forecast at 103.3 million in 1997/98 against consumption of 100.6 million, UK broker GNI said in the October issue of its commodity perspective report.
The brokerage put the world 1996/97 deficit of 4.48 million bags, with consumption of 99.14 million bags outpacing production of 94.66 million.
GNI put 1997/98 exports unchanged at 75 million bags.
It said world stocks will rise to 24.18 million bags at the end of September 1998.
This compares with 21.41 million bags at the end of September 1997 and a hefty 39.87 million at the end of September 1995.
